title: What is an OTG pen drive? - Quora

response.answer_text: hi first of all… generally pendrives can be connected to laptops, PCs etc. but cant be connected to Mobile phones, tablets etc. Coz the usb port is different for the. So otg cables were used first to connect a pendrive to the mobile, having the 2 on 2 different ends. then otg adaptors came which can be connected to the mobile and pendrive shall be connected whenever required. Nowadays pendrives themselves come with OTG porton one end and the normal usb on the other end for ease of access with the mobile systems.

An OTG pendrive simply has 2 heads . On one side it has USB A port which fits into your computers and on the other side it has a micro USB port which fits into your phone . It helps to simply eliminate an OTG connector . If you're planning to buy one , I would suggest SanDisk . It's pretty good and reliable too . Edit- Image added  Cheers! Hope it helps!
